item.title: Cracking the Coding Interview - Linked Lists - The Runner Technique
item.description: I’ve been going over the Linked List section of Cracking the Coding Interview and most times I get stumped with a problem the solution is the Runner Technique (or slow/fast pointers). The idea behind the runner technique is simple; use two pointers that either move at different speeds or are a set distance apart and iterate through a list. Why is this so useful? In some linked list problems you need to know the position of a certain element or the length of the list.
